To define the weights of genes, we first downloaded the RNA-seq data from TCGA [ 26], which contains gene expression data from 1102 breast tumour samples and 113 normal samples. Next, the counts of level 3 RNASeqV2 data were processed and transformed before being used for further analysis [ 27]. Specifically, we used the fold change (FC) value (with the binary logarithm and absolute value) between tumour and normal samples as the weight of each vertex (gene).
